column4: Is there anyone that would walk me through trying to get ubuntu to mount an external HD ( I have been at it for 2 days ) and I am very very frustrated - I know its me, I just dont know what I am doing wrong
what sort of HD? USB I presume?
well, first thing i would try is just to plug it in, see if it comes up under computer. if not, open a terminal window or go to the gnome partiton window (if installed)
do you know what format the hard drive is in? e.g. NTFS? FAT? HFS?
ok, and Ubuntu version?
when you get a list, find the one that sounds about the right size (if it gives labels even better) and remember the bit after /dev/
did the fdisk output have anything under that text, e.g. a table with headings "device boot", "start", "end",etc.
so nothing like /dev/sde1     1   etc.    NTFS there?
ur right
my fault, you'll need to work out which partition the NTFS is in without fdisk as it said it didn't support your GPT filesystem table
do u know that the drive is one whole partiton?
hmm, weird, but that might be why it can't automount.
in the terminal, create a folder ("sudo mkdir /media/ntfsdrive/") then...
...then "sudo mount -t ntfs /dev/sde2 /media/ntfsdrive" and tell me what it outputs
could it be the drive has failed?
now try forcing it to be ntfs with "sudo -t ntfs /dev/sde2 /media/ntfsdrive -o force"
have u ever tried it in a windows pc?
sorry, typo, essentially same as lasttime but with -o force on end, (there should have been the word mount b4 -t)
you sure you put in /dev/sde2 rather than just without the 2
if so, you can try again i guess with 1 and 3 but i doubt you will get much luck. do you have lots of data on there you need (e.g. re-formatting is not an option) or could you re-format?

i know what you mean. for safety's sake i would recommend using it in a windows pc, and possibly doing a scan disk or backup, rather than trying more drastic measures such as rebuilding partition tables or doing other nasty things
np, but i'm really sorry i couldn't actually do anything that results in a successful result.
